intro: Dalechampia roezliana var. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian spurge, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of the Amazon basin.
